Class PlayGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Slide
              • PlayGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class PlayGame
extends Slide
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    This is the main class where the gameplay takes place. The rooms, character data, and dungeon is set up here. The map is set up at first, then all the graphics are added to the panel.

    Modifications

    May 22,2017 Arsh made first draft of the class to display nothing.

    May 27,2017 Daniel made second draft of the playGame class to display a rooms and be able to move through them.

    June 02,2017 Arsh changes the playGame class to make it more simple to set up the map and rooms.

    June 04,2016 Arsh merges Daniel's dungeon class with the playGame class.

    Authors: Arsh Raza, Daniel Arakcheev Version: 2.0 ICS 4U0 Date: June 04, 2017 Time Spent: 14 hours Ms. Krasteva

    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayGame

        public PlayGame(Application app)
        This is the class constructor. Used to call the functions to draw the rooms and characters. Adds everything to the main panel.

    • Method Detail

      • setCharacter

        public void setCharacter()
        This method is used to set up the character panel. It adds all the images in and then adds them to the correct location on the panel.

      • move

        public void move(int dir)
        This method moves the character. It moves it either vertically or horizontally by the speed.

        Local Variables

        dir An integer that represents which direction to move the character.

      • detectTrapdoor

        public Trapdoor detectTrapdoor()
        This method is used to detect whether or not a player has collided with a trapdoor. *

        Local Variables

        player A rectangle object to represent the player location.

        td A rectangle object to represent the locations of the trapdoors.

      • doorIsNear

        public int doorIsNear()
        This method checks whether or not the player has collided with a door. If they have, it returns the door direction number, otherwise it returns -1.

      • drawRoom

        public void drawRoom(int roomNum)
        This methods draws the room.

        Local Variables

        heartImgThis is a variable for the picture of the heart,

        keyImgThis is a variable for the picture of the key,

        heartCountThis is a JLabel to display the lives count,

        keyCountThis is a JLabel to keep track of the count of keys.

      • setMap

        public void setMap()
        This method sets the map arrays up by reading in the map from the Map.txt folder. It also sets up the trapdoors in each room.

        Local Variables

        roomNum The number of the correct room being processed.

        questionSet A QuestionSet variable used to get random questions for each trapdoor.

        Exception handling

        Exception handling used to read from the file.

      • initDun

        public void initDun()
        This method is used to initialize the dungeon panel. It displays the questions, character, monsters, and triggers the animations.

        Local Variables

        j Used to position the hearts properly by multiplying y value of hearts by j.

      • reset

        Used to reset amount of lives and greenflash.
